intro: Hyoseris exigua, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to North America and typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and roadsides. The plant features small, yellowish flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters, and its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped. It is an annual or biennial plant that produces seeds in a capsule-like structure. Hyoseris exigua is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
